message.content:
Step 1. Current Ratio  
• From the balance sheet, the ending Total Current Assets = 10,619,895.35 and Total Current Liabilities = 624,988.48.  
• Current Ratio = 10,619,895.35 / 624,988.48 ≈ 16.99  

Step 2. Quick Ratio  
• Quick Assets typically include Cash on Hand, Bank Deposits, Interest Receivable, and Accounts Receivable.  
• Sum of Quick Assets = 4,058,544.03 + 3,079,000.00 + 13,279.60 + 2,984,071.72 = 10,134,895.35  
• Quick Ratio = 10,134,895.35 / 624,988.48 ≈ 16.22  

Step 3. Debt to Asset Ratio  
• Total Liabilities are given by the Total Current Liabilities = 624,988.48 (no non-current liabilities are shown).  
• Total Assets = 15,528,390.30  
• Debt to Asset Ratio = 624,988.48 / 15,528,390.30 ≈ 0.04  

Step 4. Debt to Equity Ratio  
• Owner’s Equity at the end = 14,903,401.82  
• Debt to Equity Ratio = 624,988.48 / 14,903,401.82 ≈ 0.04  

Step 5. Cash Flow to Debt Ratio  
• From the cash flow statement, the Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –862,455.97  
• Total Debt (using Total Liabilities) = 624,988.48  
• Cash Flow to Debt Ratio = –862,455.97 / 624,988.48 ≈ –1.38  

Thus, the solution in the required json format is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Current Ratio": "16.99",
    "Quick Ratio": "16.22",
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.04",
    "Debt to Equity Ratio": "0.04",
    "Cash Flow to Debt Ratio": "-1.38"
  }
}
